title: RockForce Expands U.S. Footprint With QSR ProductionsÂ Acquisition
summary: The production company behind events like Electric Daisy Carnival is expanding its U.S. footprint with a new deal.
body: RockForce, the live event services company behind mega-productions like Coachella and Electric Daisy Carnival, is expanding its national reach through the acquisition of QSR Productions, an Oklahoma-based provider of stagehands, riggers, loaders, camera operators and spotlight operators. With operations in Oklahoma City and Tulsa, Okla., QSR strengthens RockForceâ€™s presence in Oklahoma and Texas, a fast-growing hub for concerts, festivals, corporate events and trade shows. The move bolsters RockForceâ€™s workforce division, which supplies site and steel crews, rigging services and on-site leadership across events of all sizes. title: How Pat Benatar & Neil Giraldoâ€™s Grandkids Inspired Them to Write a Childrenâ€™s Book, Because â€˜All GrandparentsÂ Rockâ€™
summary: "We read it to them every step of the way," Benatar says of My Grandma and Grandpa Rock!, out today.
body: It’s fair to say that when Pat Benatar and her then-future husband Neil Giraldo were in the studio during the summer of 1979 to record her debut album, In the Heat of the Night , the idea of a children’s book wasn’t on their radar. But 46 years, 11 studio albums, four Grammy Awards and a Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction later, the couple are grandparents to three (Stevie, 7, Lola, 6 and Cash, 2 ) — and now, co-authors of My Grandma and Grandpa Rock! , a children’s book publishing Tuesday (Sept. 9). Related Pat Benatar & Neil Giraldo to Receive 2025 ASCAP Harry Chapin Humanitarian Award Rob Reiner on Making 'Spinal Tap II: The End Continues,' Drawing From Kate Bush & Working With 'Really Funny' Paul McCartney Don Was Signals Detroit Homecoming With 'Groove in the Face of Adversity': 'Spreading a Little Joy and Comfort Is a Noble Undertaking' “About a year ago the oldest one, Stevie — she’s very precocious and very smart — was talking to us and saying, ‘Well, everybody’s grandma and grandpa have a tour bus.’ And I said, ‘Actually, no, everyone’s grandma and grandpa do not have a toâ€¦

title: Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson Form Ultimate Feel-Good Neil Diamond Tribute Band in First â€˜Song Sung Blueâ€™Â Trailer
summary: The real-life story of the song "interpreters" due out at Christmas also stars Michael Imperioli, Ella Anderson and King Princess.
body: First things first: Lightning & Thunder are not a Neil Diamond cover band, they are Diamond “interpreters.” That’s what a Hugh Jackman ‘s Mike Sardina learns from Kate Hudson ‘s Claire Stengl in the first trailer for the pair’s upcoming holiday feel-good movie Song Sung Blue . The pairing of the actors who both have deep musical experience â€” Jackman in a number of Broadway musicals and Hudson via her 2024 album Glorious â€” comes in a film telling the real-life story of two struggling musicians who find their special purpose when they form a Diamond-covering duo. â€œIâ€™m not a songwriter, Iâ€™m not a sex symbol â€” I just want to entertain people,â€ Jackmanâ€™s Sardina tells Hudsonâ€™s Stengl in the sneak peek of the film from writer-director Craig Brewer ( Coming 2 America ). â€œI donâ€™t wanna be a hairdresser,â€ Stengl tells him. â€œI wanna sing, I wanna dance, I wanna garden, I want a cat.â€ Desperate for something “big” and “new,” Sardina picks up a copy of Diamond’s 1972 Moods album, which, of course, features the singer’s Billboard Hot 100 No. 1 hit “Song Sung Blue,” with Stengl counseling that Sardina doesn&â€¦

title: Ty Dolla $ign and Shawn Barron Honored at Billboardâ€™s Future of Music & MoneyÂ Event
summary: Billboard returned to New York for a celebration of Hip-Hop and R&Bâ€™s influence across both culture and business.
body: Billboard returned to New York City for another unforgettable week of events celebrating Hip-Hop and R&B, marking its continued commitment to showcasing the evolving landscape of the genre. In partnership with UBS and powered by Feeture, Billboard hosted a high-profile event titled The Future of Music & Money . The evening brought together a star-studded group of talent, music industry executives, and top finance professionals to dive into discussions around the future of music as an asset class, highlighting the growing intersection of music, technology, and investment. Erica Harris DeValve A standout moment of the evening was the presentation of the Collab Impact Award which was given to Ty Dolla $ign, and the Exec Impact Award given to EZMNY CEO, Shawn Barron, via Feeture â€“ the industry-leading, global artist collaboration platform. The award ceremony honored their invaluable contributions to both the music and business sides of the industry. Erica Harris DeValve For Ty Dolla $ign, the recognition serves as yet another milestone in a career defined by versatility and boundary-pushing collaborations. For Shawn Barron, his leadership at EZMNY has positioned him as a key pâ€¦

title: Lady Gaga Pens Heartfelt Note to FiancÃ© Michael Polansky for Making Her Feel Like the â€˜Luckiest GirlÂ Aliveâ€™
summary: The pop star also thanked her future husband for his work with her on her latest album and tour.
body: With a sold-out arena tour, four wins at the 2025 VMAs and a critically beloved album under her belt this year, Lady Gaga is riding high. Now, she wants to make sure that she gives credit to one of the most important people who helped get her to where she is now. Related Lady Gaga Takes Mayhem Ball on a Victory Lap With Second North American Leg in 2026: Here Are the Dates Women Artists, Led by Lady Gaga & Ariana Grande, Own 2025 VMAs Lady Gaga Performs Mesmerizing, Stripped-Down Version of ‘Vanish Into You’ on ‘Late Show’ In a lengthy post shared to her Instagram on Monday (Sept. 8), Gaga paid tribute to her fiancÃ©, Michael Polansky, thanking him for the way that he’s helped lift her up over the last few years. “Dreaming up this album, making the plan, building every vision with you — talking endlessly about what we would create and do for monsters has been an experience I could not have ever imagined,” she wrote in the caption, sharing two pictures of her and Polansky â€” one backstage at the Mayhem Ball, and another of the two of them posing in the desert. Gaga continued, specifically singling out the attention anâ€¦

title: A New Los Angeles Venue Will Open This Fall With a Set FromÂ Solomun
summary: The legend will take over the space for an outdoor show on Nov. 29.
body: A new Los Angeles venue will open its doors in high style this fall with a set from Solomun . The Bosnian-German dance titan will play Reframe Studios Outdoors on November 29, with California’s own Max Styler opening the show. The performance will mark the first event at Reframe Studios Outdoors, a never before used venue located on the grounds of Reframe Studios in the city’s Atwater Village neighborhood. The show is be produced by Los Angeles-based dance event leader Framework, which will continue doing shows at the venue after this debut. The performance will serve as the finale to Framework’s 2025 outdoor season. Related ‘The Walls of the Building Were Missing, But I Just Saw a Club’: The Oral History of Miami’s Club Space Tileyard Education and BMG Production Library Release Four New EPs Showcasing Emerging Songwriters Miranda Lambert Set to Headline Colorado's Ford Amphitheater on Sept. 28 Framework is also behind a laundry list of dance events in special locations around Los Angeles, including Dom Dolla at The Dock at the Historic Sears Building last October, 2024 shows with Duke Dumont and Rampa at film production house Red Stuâ€¦

title: Body Found in Trunk of Car Registered toÂ D4vd
summary: The singer is currently on the road for his Withered World Tour.
body: Los Angeles police discovered a body inside an impounded Tesla in Hollywood on Monday (Sept. 8), and according to ABC7 , the vehicle is registered to D4vd. A spokesperson for the LAPD tells Billboard that officers responded to a call of a “foul odor” coming from the car in a tow yard around 12:20 p.m. on Monday before finding the “possible human remains.” The case is “currently a death investigation.” According to KTLA , the body was found in a bag in the trunk of the car, which was abandoned roughly a week ago. ABC7 reports that the vehicle is a 2023 Tesla, which is registered in Texas to David Anthony Burke, which is the singer’s real name. Billboard has reached out to reps for D4vd. The 20-year-old artist is currently in the midst of his Withered World Tour, with a stop slated for Minneapolis on Tuesday (Sept. 9). The rest of the trek includes shows in Kansas City, Denver, Salt Lake City, Portland, Seattle, San Francisco and Los Angeles. The Houston native is also scheduled to head overseas in October, when D4vd will invade Norway, Denmark, Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, Ireland, the U.K., France, Switzerland, Austria and Poâ€¦

title: Odeal Named Amazon Music Breakthrough Artist Following Billboard Hip-Hop/R&B LIVEÂ Performance
summary: Billboardâ€™s inaugural African Rookie of the Year singer joins Amazon Musicâ€™s signature developing artist program.
body: Fresh off his standout set at Billboard Hip-Hop/R&B LIVE 2025, Odeal has been tapped as Amazon Musicâ€™s newest Breakthrough Artist, joining the streaming serviceâ€™s signature developing artist program designed to spotlight and elevate rising talent. “Through my travels and experiences around the world, my music has become a reflection of the diverse cultures that have shaped me. Every place I’ve been has added new depth to my sound and my story,â€ said Odeal. â€œWith the support of Amazon Music, I’m excited to take that fusion even further and continue pushing creative boundaries.” Odeal performs onstage at the Billboard R&B/Hip-Hop LIVE held at Webster Hall on September 05, 2025 in New York, New York. Deanie Chen Under this initiative, the Love Renaissance (LVRN) Records signee will receive wide-ranging support from Amazon Music, spanning bespoke video content, a global marketing campaign, increased playlisting, and exclusive performance opportunities. Odeal’s Breakthrough campaign will be developed hand-in-hand with the artist and his team, with the goal of making his most ambitious creative visions a reality. Odeal performs onstage at the Billboâ€¦

title: Bernal wins as another Vuelta stage cut short by protests
summary: Colombia's Egan Bernal wins stage 16 of the Vuelta a Espana that had to be shortened by eight kilometres because of pro-Palestinian protests.

title: R&B/Hip-Hop Fresh Picks of the Week: 3Quency, Queen Naija, Veeze, Errol Holden &Â More
summary: Listen to new must-hear songs from emerging R&B/hip-hop artists like Dess Dior and rumâ€¢gold.
body: As the first fall breezes start to drift across New York City, Billboard helped usher out the summer season with its annual R&B/Hip-Hop Power Players Week. On Wednesday (Sept. 3), Unfiltered Live welcomed its very first in-studio audience for a Cash Cobain and Zeddy Will-led debate about the current king or queen of New York rap. That same day, The Orchard hosted a special conversation (“The Future of Hip-Hop Is Global”) at NeueHouse Madison Square. On Thursday (Sept. 4), Billboard honored several stars across R&B, hip-hop and African music at its Unveiled-hosted Power Players event , including cover stars Leon Thomas and Cardi B , as well as Wu-Tang Clan, Ravyn Lenae, Odeal, GELO, Anthony “Top Dawg” Tiffith and Alamo Records. To close out the week (Sept. 5), Billboard also teamed up with UBS and EZMNY for a cocktail party honoring Thomas, Ty Dolla $ign and veteran A&R exec Shawn Barron. That very evening, Thomas, Lenade, Odeal, GELO and rising dancehall star Armanii blew the roof off of Webster Hall during Billboard’s R&B/Hip-Hop Live concert . Outside of Billboard ‘s festivities, the hip-hop and R&B worlds remained busy. Maâ€¦

summary: Emma Sing or Helena Rowland - who should replace England's star full-back Ellie Kildunne for Sunday's Women's Rugby World Cup quarter-final with Scotland?

title: 'Partisan Irish fans provide timely Ryder Cup reminder'
summary: Irish Open fans willing Joakim Lagergren's ball into water to help Rory McIlroy win hint at what may unfold at this month's Ryder Cup, writes Iain Carter.

title: Redemption for former soldier in the 109-mile 'Super Bowl' of trail running
summary: British trail runner Tom Evans wins the prestigious Ultra-Trail du Mont-Blanc in his fourth entry in the race.

title: Alcaraz overcomes Sinner to win US Open
summary: Carlos Alcaraz triumphs in the latest chapter of his compelling rivalry with Jannik Sinner, earning a four-set victory to regain the US Open title.

title: 'A heavy shirt to wear' - being Man Utd number one
summary: An in-depth look at Manchester United's goalkeeping situation as Andre Onana prepares to leave on loan.

title: The wonderkids who didn't make it
summary: The Premier League has a history of young players making it big - which has continued this season - but not every starlet has followed up their bright start.

title: The self-written note that inspired Alcaraz to win US Open
summary: Before the US Open, Carlos Alcaraz told himself to "go for it, don't be afraid". He lived by that motto as he went on to take the title.

title: Ten standout moments from World Cup pool stage
summary: Here are 10 standout moments from the pool stage of the Women's Rugby World Cup - some of which went viral.

title: Rooney responds to Owen claims on who was better
summary: Wayne Rooney responds to recent online comments from former England team-mate Michael Owen about which striker was a more prodigious talent as a teenager.

title: 'I pretended to be Owen on the street - but you can't compare us'
summary: Which England great was better aged 17 - Wayne Rooney or Michael Owen? After Owen started the debate, Rooney replies in his latest BBC podcast.

title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

title: WHO, WMO issue new report and guidance to protect workers from increasing heat stress
summary: The WHO and WMO have released a comprehensive technical report and guidance addressing the escalating global health and economic risks posed by extreme heat, particularly in the workplace. This guidance builds on five decades of research and responds to the record-breaking temperatures of recent yeâ€¦

title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

title: WHO designates new WHO-Listed Authorities, strengthening global access to quality-assured medical products
summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has officially designated Health Canada, the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare/Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency (MHLW/PMDA) of Japan, and the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) of the United Kingdom as WHO-Listed Authoritiesâ€¦

title: Kenya achieves elimination of human African trypanosomiasis or sleeping sickness as a public health problem
summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has validated Kenya as having eliminated human African trypanosomiasis (HAT) or sleeping sickness as a public health problem, making it the tenth country to reach this important milestone. HAT is the second neglected tropical disease (NTD) to be eliminated in Kenâ€¦

title: On World Breastfeeding Week, countries urged to invest in health systems and support breastfeeding mothers
summary: Strengthening health systems to support breastfeeding is not just a health imperative, it is a moral and economic imperative. WHO and UNICEF remain committed to supporting countries to build resilient health systems that leave no mother or child behind.

title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

title: Paying tribute to David Nabarro
summary: Tribute to Dr David Nabarro

title: Global hunger declines, but rises in Africa and western Asia: UN report
summary: An estimated 8.2 percent of the global population, or about 673 million people, experienced hunger in 2024, according to the latest State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World (SOFI) report published today by five United Nations specialized agencies.

title: WHO urges action on hepatitis, announcing hepatitis D as carcinogenic
summary: As we mark World Hepatitis Day, WHO calls on governments and partners to urgently accelerate efforts to eliminate viral hepatitis as a public health threat and reduce liver cancer deaths. "Every 30 seconds, someone dies from a hepatitis-related severe liver disease or liver cancer. Yet we have the â€¦

title: Senegal joins growing list of countries that have eliminated trachoma
summary: WHO has validated Senegal as having eliminated trachoma as a public health problem. Senegal becomes the ninth country in WHOâ€™s African Region to have achieved this feat.

title: Global childhood vaccination coverage holds steady, yet over 14 million infants remain unvaccinated â€“ WHO, UNICEF
summary: In 2024, 89% of infants globally received at least one dose of the diphtheria, tetanus and pertussis (DTP)-containing vaccine, and 85% completed all three doses, according to new data released today by WHO and UNICEF. Despite the progress, the latest estimates highlight a concerning trajectory.

title: Burundi eliminates trachoma as a public health problem
summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has validated Burundi as having eliminated trachoma as a public health problem, making it the eighth country in WHOâ€™s African Region to reach this important milestone. Trachoma is also the first neglected tropical disease (NTD) to be eliminated in the country.

title: WHO, ITU, WIPO showcase a new report on AI use in traditional medicine
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is ushering in a transformative era for traditional medicine, one where centuries-old healing systems are enhanced by cutting-edge technologies to deliver more safe, personalized, effective, and accessible care. At the AI for Good Global Summit, the World Health Organizâ€¦

title: Fourth meeting of the International Health Regulations (2005) Emergency Committee regarding the upsurge of mpox 2024
summary: Concurring with the advice unanimously expressed by the Committee during the meeting, the WHO Director-General determined that the upsurge of mpox 2024 continues to meet the criteria of a public health emergency of international concern (PHEIC) and, accordingly, on 9 June 2025, issued temporary recâ€¦

title: How Hampton overcame odds to become England's number one
summary: Hannah Hampton on overcoming a serious eye condition to rise to become England's number one goalkeeper at Euro 2025.

title: Readout on WHO participation in global nuclear emergency exercise
summary: On 25 June, the World Health Organization (WHO) concluded its participation in a 36-hour nuclear emergency exercise organized by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). The exercise was part of the IAEAâ€™s Level 3 Convention Exercise (ConvEx-3), the highest and most complex level of its emergâ€¦

title: WHO launches bold push to raise health taxes and save millions of lives
summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today has launched a major new initiative urging countries to raise real prices on tobacco, alcohol, and sugary drinks by at least 50% by 2035 through health taxes in a move designed to curb chronic diseases and generate critical public revenue.
